quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Car and Number
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, process, depoyster. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1963 this soundtrack broke the record for the most weeks as the number one album on the Billboard charts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Side Story

questions.question: The worlds largest swimming pool in 2007 was in this country.
This luxury U.S. car make was founded in 1902 from what had remained from the Henry Ford Company, and in 1909 it was bought by General Motors.
In 1889, this French car brand produced its first automobile, a three-wheeled car powered by steam and designed by Leon Serpollet.
Sportsman Jerry DePoyster is a record breaker in this category.

options.text: Fastest 100 yard dash on roller skates
Longest field goal in an NBA game
Worst pass completion record in an NFL season

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shortest punt in the NFL

questions.question: This was the largest active passenger airplane for 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Airbus A380

questions.question: This was the world’s largest university for 2007 (considering total active enrollment.)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Allama Iqbal Open University

questions.question: Who is the first performer/band to have at least 36 Billboard Top Ten albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: Which of these performers/bands has had the number one and number two albums on the Billboard chart twice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guns n Roses

questions.question: The Freedom of the Seas was the largest cruise ship for 2007. It is owned by Royal Caribbean. Which statement is NOT true about this ship?

options.text: It is about 1,112 feet (340 m) long by 184 feet (56 m) wide.
It is about as tall as the CN Tower.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is about as tall as the CN Tower.

questions.question: This Italian car make, founded in 1963, has a bull on its emblem.
Which was the first music album to sell at least 20 million units?

options.text: Billy Joel - Greatest HitsVolumes I and II

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin - Led Zeppelin IV

questions.question: Who was the first performer to have both the Billboard number one and number two album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Newhart

questions.question: The first passenger car of this Japanese car make was built in 1936. The brand also operates Lexus and Scion.
In 2005, Danny Way became the first person to do this. In the process he attained a speed of over 50 mph. What did he do?

options.text: Skateboard over the Great Wall of China
High dive from the Eiffel Tower
Shoot out of a submarine torpedo tube

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skateboard over the Great Wall of China

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Car and Vampire
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, diseases, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where did the first reported attacks of the legendary blood-sucking creature called Chupacabra occur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puerto Rico

questions.question: The founder of this German car brand produced the first petrol-powered motorcycle in the world, as well as the first gasoline-powered automobile.
What cruel punishment did Vlad III, Prince of Wallachia, who inspired Bram Stokers 1897 novel Dracula, like to impose?
The African vampiric creature, known as Adze, was believed to take the form of this animal in order to hunt children.
In February 2004, In Romania the relatives of a dead man called Toma Petre were terrified of the thought that he had become a vampire. What did they do?

options.text: They hired a priest to keep an eye on his grave at night.
They planted garlic on his grave and all around the graveyard.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They exhumed his corpse.

questions.question: Which of these diseases has been connected with vampires, as some of the symptoms were interpreted as vampirism?
Which of these plants was believed to scare off vampires and keep them at bay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild rose

questions.question: According to Slavic belief, what type of death caused the soul to become unclean and potentially transformed a corpse into a vampire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This American car make was founded in 1911, and was purchased by General Motors in 1917.
This Italian car brand was founded on June 24, 1910 in Milan. Its badge features a red cross and a serpent devouring a human.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfa Romeo

questions.question: This British car make was founded under the name Swallow Sidecar Company in 1922, and is known for its elegant sports cars and luxury saloons.
In 2006 a female corpse dating from the 16th century was found near Venice. According to archaeologists the presence of this object in the corpses mouth was the result of a vampire-slaying ritual.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A brick

questions.question: The slogan of this Japanese car make, founded on September 24, 1948, is The Power of Dreams.
A popular method of finding a vampires grave involved this animal that would supposedly balk at the grave.
What German car make, founded in 1931, is famous for its high performance luxury automobiles?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fear and Phobia
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, superman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does demophobia mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear of crowds

questions.question: This concept was popularized in Dostoevskys Notes from the Underground, Pushkins Eugene Onegin and in many of the works of Turgenev.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Superfluous Man

questions.question: Elurophobia means fear of cats.
What phobia is referred as fear of houses?
What does C.W. Ettingers book Man into Superman deal with?
What phobia means fear of making decisions?
Who played Clark Kent/Superman in the 1948 Superman movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kirk Alyn

questions.question: Which of the following starred in the movie Superfly?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron ONeal

questions.question: This phobia is known as the fear of criticism.
What is the word for fear of horses?
Which of these serial murderers was nicknamed The Vampire of Sacramento, as he drank the blood and ate the remains of his victims?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Chase

questions.question: What term means fear of skin diseases?
Dinophobia is defined as fear of stories about dinosaurs.
Name the famous (infamous?) philosopher who posited the concept of The Superman(Der Ubermensch).
Name the young actor who starred in 2006s Civic Duty and whose nicknames include Superman and Dodi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Khaled Abol Naga

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Names and Meaning
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, mean, electricity. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the origin of the popular feminine names Susanna, Susan, Sue, Suzie, Sanna?
What do the names Matthew, Mathew, Matt and Mat mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gift of God

questions.question: Which set of numbers is most significant to baseball?
The popular female names Alice, Alicia and Alisha, all mean what?
The names Robert, Robbie, Rob, Robin, Robyn, Roberto, Bert, refer to what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bright fame

questions.question: What is the meaning of the female names Anastasia, Anastacia, Stacy, Nastassja, Nastia?
Fear of riding a taxi is referred as epistaxiophobia.
What do  the male name Thomas and its derivatives Tom, Thom, Tomas, Tomm all mean?
What is the meaning of the names Paul, Paula, Paulina, Pablo, Paulo, Paolo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Small, humble

questions.question: Which year is most significant to Napoleon Bonaparte?
What is the meaning of the names Emily, Emma, Amelie, Amelia, Em, Emmie?
What do the names Henry, Harry, Harrison, Hal, Hank, Enrique mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Home ruler

questions.question: What is known as the fear of electricity?
Do all of the U.S. Armed Forces have the rank of General?
What is the meaning of the popular names Joseph, Josephine, Jose, Josef, Joe, Joey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lord will add.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: General and Crash
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, malaysia, wynnewood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which of these New York City neighborhoods did the American Airlines Flight 587 crash on November 12, 2001?

This General, born in Wynnewood Oklahoma, was the U.S. general leading the attack on the Taliban in Afghanistan in response to the September 11th 2001 attacks on the World Trade Center and The Pentagon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy Franks

questions.question: What caused the tragedy with the Saudia Flight 163 on August 19, 1980?
This U.S. general, born in Little Rock Arkansas, fought in 3 major wars (World War I, World War II, Korean War) and was one of the few men ever to rise to the rank of General of the Army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Douglas MacArthur

questions.question: This famous general is considered to be one of the most gifted tactical commanders in United States history. He excelled at the First Battle of Bull Run (where he received his famous nickname), Antietam, and Fredericksburg. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jonathon Jackson

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the Pan Am Flight 759 disaster that happened on July 9, 1982?

options.text: It was flying from Miami to Las Vegas.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: There is no limit to how many persons with rank General can be in service in the U.S. Armed Forces at one time.
What did the American Airlines Flight 965 crash into on December 20, 1995 in Colombia?
What was the reason for the crash of West Caribbean Airways Flight 708 in Venezuela on August 16, 2005?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Engine trouble

questions.question: Which general born in New York in 1954 was elected the 10th Commander of the U.S. Central Command?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Petraeus

questions.question: Where did the South African Airways Flight 295 crash on 28 November 1987?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indian ocean

questions.question: What was the cause of one of the deadliest airplane disasters in history that happened on 26 April 1994 with China Airlines Flight 140?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pilot error

questions.question: Before 2008 a female had not attained the rank of a 4-Star General in U.S. history.
Where did the TAM Airlines Flight 3054 deadly accident from July 17, 2007 occur?
What was the cause of the Malaysia Airlines Flight 653 crash on 4 December 1977?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Month and Birthstone
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, opal, anniversary. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What month has the garnet for its birthstone and the snowdrop for its birth flower?
The diamond is chosen as the birthstone of this month.
What was the destination of the Air France Flight 447 that crashed on June 1, 2009 in the Atlantic Ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris, France

questions.question: The turquoise and poinsettia are symbols of this winter month.
What is the meaning of the term blood diamond?

options.text: Diamond for which somebody has died

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diamond used for financing wars

questions.question: Narcissus is the birth flower of this month, and its birthstone is the aquamarine.
The calendula, or marigold and the opal are the symbols of this month.
Which wedding anniversary is celebrated internationally as the Diamond Wedding Anniversary, or Diamond Wedding Day?
The amethyst is the symbol and birthstone of this month.
The birthstone of this month is the yellow topaz, and its birth flower is the chrysanthemum.
What month has the pearl for its birthstone and the rose for its birth flower?
The birthstone of this month is the emerald, and its birth flower is Lily of the Valley.
The symbols of this month are the sapphire and the forget-me-not.
What geographical area does the Diamond Dove populate?
What does the term baseball diamond denote?

options.text: A title given to the greatest baseball players

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baseball field
